description: bearded man with back to viewer in a jester's cap; holds stick in one hand with cloth bundle hanging from the end and slung across his back; walking stick and cat appear on lower half of card; LE MAT printed on bottom border; from a deck of 78 hand-colored triumph playing cards
inscription: Designer and date printed on the lemniscate (ribbon) of the Two of Pentacles: [Claude.Burdel.Cartier.Et Graveur.1751]
portfolio: From Tarot of Marseilles Playing Cards
provenance:
'Lady Charlotte Elizabeth Schrieber, 1812-1895, London [1]. Carl A. Weyerhaeuser, Minneapolis (by 1937-1996; given to MIA)

1. Note with deck states: "Swiss Tarot. / Complete 78 Cards / from Schreiber Collection"
title: The Fool
